text: A really, very good brown. Deep and rich in malty, chocolatey sweetness. Has a nice caramel backbone and a sharp bitter finish. Tried with Dave, Josh, Brandon, and Brian at Bad Apple in 2017 after ASEH.

Pours a brown with a medium tan head. I get a heavier dose of chocolate and caramel in the aroma, along with nuts, earthy malts, and a faint licorice impression. The taste is sweet with some lighter bitterness. Here we get chocolate and cocoa dominating, some pine, earthy malts, a fair amount of licorice, and minor cereal. The aftertaste is an earthy cocoa flavor which is strong and lasts for a good amount of time. This is more full in body, with a chewy texture, and about average in carbonation. Its pretty good.

As good a brown ale as I've ever had. No inauthentic tastes with a rich malt palate. The palate and aroma both have a complexity that adjusts throughout. 




In a bottle - Naperville.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Pour is cloudy dark brown with a small beige head. Notes of nuts, chocolate syrup, biscuits, caramel, and pine needles.
Aroma is toffee/caramel, slightly nutty malts and chocolate. The flavor is nutty malts, chocolate, toffee and a slightly bitter/alcoholic finish.

Bottle. Pours an opaque dark brown with a lasting fluffy light beige head. Aroma is of caramel, nuts, biscuit, chocolate, hint of pine. Taste is of chocolate, biscuits, caramel, pine, grassy. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Tasted from a 12oz. bottle (thanks Joe). It poured a dark reddish brown hue with a frothy beige head. Spiced malt aroma with a roasted malt taste and a hint of chocolate from the cacao nibs. A tasty brown ale that seems like a nice fall to winter brew.
On draft at TapWorks. Pours dark brown with small tan head. Taste of dark chocolate with light bitterness on back end. Good drinking beer.

This is really more of a porter by my reckoning and its good so I dont care. Its clear garnet brown w/ a long-lasting foamy head.Its mildly roasty w/ a touch of caramely malt sweetness to compliment. Its medium bodied and smooth on the palate w/ fairly moderate carbonation. It finishes w/ some coffee like bitterness and a hint of lingering sugar. I kinda wish this was a bit lower alcohol so II could drink more of it.
Pours a really nice dark chocolate color. Roasted chocolate some coffee nose. Good dark chocolate bread with slight bitter. Bubbly.
Dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma has some roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. The flavor adds some bitter cocoa on the finish that balances nicely with the full body sweetness. Not bad.

Taste: Cocoa nibs, dark malts, roasted kinda smokey notes. Super creamy mouth-feel.
Malt and cocoa nose.
Dark Brown and semi opaque in appearance, with a creamy head of lace on the glass.
The full body and chocolate notes paired well with the Chucks BBQ food we had when sampling this tasty Brown ale. 
35 IBUs
Cocoa nibs and sugar. Brown pour from bottle at cheesies. White head. Good flavor and tasty
At Blue Frog Local 22. Very rich and creamy, almost porter like. Slippery mouth feel. Cocoa and coffee. Serving: Tap
Draft. Brown pour. Cocoa and nut aroma. Flavor.us dark fruits and cocoa. Lower.carb smooth.
